addressLine1.description: The first line of the address.

city.description: The city where the person, business, or institution is located.

countryCode.description: The two digit country code. In ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

districtOrCounty.description: The district or county where the person, business, or institution is located.

name.description: The name of the person, business or institution at the address.

phone.description: The phone number of the person, business, or institution located at the address.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the address.

stateOrRegion.description: The state or region where the person, business or institution is located.

CODSettings.description: The COD (Cash On Delivery) charges that you associate with a COD fulfillment order.

isCodRequired.description: When true, this fulfillment order requires a COD (Cash On Delivery) payment.

CancelFulfillmentOrderResponse.description: The response schema for the cancelFulfillmentOrder operation.

CreateFulfillmentOrderItem.description: Item information for creating a fulfillment order.

displayableComment.description: Item-specific text that displays in recipient-facing materials such as the outbound shipment packing slip.

fulfillmentNetworkSku.description: Amazon's fulfillment network SKU of the item.

giftMessage.description: A message to the gift recipient, if applicable.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: A fulfillment order item identifier that the seller creates to track fulfillment order items. Used to disambiguate multiple fulfillment items that have the same SellerSKU. For example, the seller might assign different SellerFulfillmentOrderItemId values to two items in a fulfillment order that share the same SellerSKU but have different GiftMessage values.

sellerSku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

CreateFulfillmentOrderItemList.description: An array of item information for creating a fulfillment order.

CreateFulfillmentOrderRequest.description: The request body schema for the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

displayableOrderComment.description: Order-specific text that appears in recipient-facing materials such as the outbound shipment packing slip.

displayableOrderId.description:
A fulfillment order identifier that the seller creates. This value displays as the order identifier in recipient-facing materials such as the outbound shipment packing slip. The value of DisplayableOrderId should match the order identifier that the seller provides to the recipient. The seller can use the SellerFulfillmentOrderId for this value or they can specify an alternate value if they want the recipient to reference an alternate order identifier.

The value must be an alpha-numeric or ISO 8859-1 compliant string from one to 40 characters in length. Cannot contain two spaces in a row. Leading and trailing white space is removed.

featureConstraints.description: A list of features and their fulfillment policies to apply to the order.

marketplaceId.description: The marketplace the fulfillment order is placed against.

sellerFulfillmentOrderId.description: A fulfillment order identifier that the seller creates to track their fulfillment order. The SellerFulfillmentOrderId must be unique for each fulfillment order that a seller creates. If the seller's system already creates unique order identifiers, then these might be good values for them to use.

shipFromCountryCode.description: The two-character country code for the country from which the fulfillment order ships. Must be in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

CreateFulfillmentOrderResponse.description: The response schema for the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

CreateFulfillmentReturnRequest.description: The createFulfillmentReturn operation creates a fulfillment return for items that were fulfilled using the createFulfillmentOrder operation. For calls to createFulfillmentReturn, you must include ReturnReasonCode values returned by a previous call to the listReturnReasonCodes operation.

CreateFulfillmentReturnResponse.description: The response schema for the createFulfillmentReturn operation.

CreateReturnItem.description: An item that Amazon accepted for return.

amazonShipmentId.description: The identifier for the shipment that is associated with the return item.

returnComment.description: An optional comment about the return item.

returnReasonCode.description: The return reason code assigned to the return item by the seller.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: The identifier assigned to the item by the seller when the fulfillment order was created.

sellerReturnItemId.description: An identifier assigned by the seller to the return item.

CreateReturnItemList.description: An array of items to be returned.

CurrentStatus.description: The current delivery status of the package.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: In transit to the destination address.
In the process of being returned to Amazon's fulfillment network.
Undeliverable because package was lost or destroyed.

Decimal.description: A decimal number with no loss of precision. Useful when precision loss is unacceptable, as with currencies. Follows RFC7159 for number representation.

DeliveryWindow.description: The time range within which a Scheduled Delivery fulfillment order should be delivered.

Error.description: Error response returned when the request is unsuccessful.

code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

ErrorList.description: A list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

EventCode.description: The event code for the delivery event.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Carrier notified to pick up package.
Shipment picked up from seller's facility.
Delay in delivery due to external factors.
Paperwork received - did not receive shipment.
Shipment received - did not receive paperwork.
Held by carrier - customer refused shipment due to customs charges.

sellerEligible.description: When true, indicates that the seller is eligible to use the feature.

FeatureSettings.description: FeatureSettings allows users to apply fulfillment features to an order. To block an order from being shipped using Amazon Logistics (AMZL) and an AMZL tracking number, use featureName as BLOCK_AMZL and featureFulfillmentPolicy as Required. Blocking AMZL will incur an additional fee surcharge on your MCF orders and increase the risk of some of your orders being unfulfilled or delivered late if there are no alternative carriers available. Using BLOCK_AMZL in an order request will take precedence over your Seller Central account setting.

featureFulfillmentPolicy.description: Specifies the policy to use when fulfilling an order.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: If the offer can't be shipped with the selected feature, reject the order.
The feature is not required for shipping.

FeatureSku.description: Information about an SKU, including the count available, identifiers, and a list of overlapping SKUs that share the same inventory pool.

asin.description: The Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) of the item.

fnSku.description: The unique SKU used by Amazon's fulfillment network.

overlappingSkus.description: Other seller SKUs that are shared across the same inventory.

sellerSku.description: Used to identify an item in the given marketplace. SellerSKU is qualified by the seller's SellerId, which is included with every operation that you submit.

skuCount.description: The number of SKUs available for this service.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Estimated fee for each unit in the fulfillment order.
Estimated COD (Cash On Delivery) fee. This fee applies only to fulfillment order previews for COD.

FeeList.description: An array of fee type and cost pairs.

FulfillmentAction.description: Specifies whether the fulfillment order should ship now or have an order hold put on it.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: An order hold is put on the fulfillment order.

FulfillmentOrder.description: General information about a fulfillment order, including its status.

displayableOrderComment.description: A text block submitted with the createFulfillmentOrder operation. Displays in recipient-facing materials such as the packing slip.

displayableOrderId.description: A fulfillment order identifier submitted with the createFulfillmentOrder operation. Displays as the order identifier in recipient-facing materials such as the packing slip.

featureConstraints.description: A list of features and their fulfillment policies to apply to the order.

marketplaceId.description: The identifier for the marketplace the fulfillment order is placed against.

sellerFulfillmentOrderId.description: The fulfillment order identifier submitted with the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

FulfillmentOrderItem.description: Item information for a fulfillment order.

displayableComment.description: Item-specific text that displays in recipient-facing materials such as the outbound shipment packing slip.

fulfillmentNetworkSku.description: Amazon's fulfillment network SKU of the item.

giftMessage.description: A message to the gift recipient, if applicable.

orderItemDisposition.description: Indicates whether the item is sellable or unsellable.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: A fulfillment order item identifier submitted with a call to the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

sellerSku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

FulfillmentOrderItemList.description: An array of fulfillment order item information.

FulfillmentOrderStatus.description: The current status of the fulfillment order.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The fulfillment order was received but not yet validated.

The fulfillment order was received and validated. Validation includes determining that the destination address is valid and that Amazon's records indicate that the seller has enough sellable (undamaged) inventory to fulfill the order. The seller can cancel a fulfillment order that has a status of Received.

The fulfillment order has been sent to Amazon's fulfillment network to begin shipment planning, but no unit in any shipment has been picked from inventory yet. The seller can cancel a fulfillment order that has a status of Planning.
The process of picking units from inventory has begun on at least one shipment in the fulfillment order. The seller cannot cancel a fulfillment order that has a status of Processing.
The fulfillment order has been cancelled by the seller.
All item quantities in the fulfillment order have been fulfilled.
Some item quantities in the fulfillment order were fulfilled; the rest were either cancelled or unfulfillable.

No item quantities in the fulfillment order could be fulfilled because the Amazon fulfillment center workers found no inventory for those items or found no inventory that was in sellable (undamaged) condition.

The fulfillment order was received but could not be validated. The reasons for this include an invalid destination address or Amazon's records indicating that the seller does not have enough sellable inventory to fulfill the order. When this happens, the fulfillment order is invalid and no items in the order will ship.

FulfillmentPolicy.description: The FulfillmentPolicy value specified when you submitted the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: If an item in a fulfillment order is determined to be unfulfillable before any shipment in the order has acquired the status of Pending (the process of picking units from inventory has begun), then the entire order is considered unfulfillable. However, if an item in a fulfillment order is determined to be unfulfillable after a shipment in the order has acquired the status of Pending, Amazon cancels as much of the fulfillment order as possible. See the FulfillmentShipment object for shipment status definitions.
All fulfillable items in the fulfillment order are shipped. The fulfillment order remains in a processing state until all items are either shipped by Amazon or cancelled by the seller.
All fulfillable items in the fulfillment order are shipped. All unfulfillable items in the order are cancelled.

FulfillmentPreview.description: Information about a fulfillment order preview, including delivery and fee information based on shipping method.

featureConstraints.description: A list of features and their fulfillment policies to apply to the order.

isCODCapable.description: When true, this fulfillment order preview is for COD (Cash On Delivery).

isFulfillable.description: When true, this fulfillment order preview is fulfillable.

marketplaceId.description: The marketplace the fulfillment order is placed against.

FulfillmentPreviewItem.description: Item information for a shipment in a fulfillment order preview.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: A fulfillment order item identifier that the seller created with a call to the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

sellerSku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

shippingWeightCalculationMethod.description: The method used to calculate the estimated shipping weight.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Based on the actual weight of the items.
Based on the cubic space that the items occupy.

FulfillmentPreviewItemList.description: An array of fulfillment preview item information.

FulfillmentPreviewList.description: An array of fulfillment preview information.

FulfillmentPreviewShipment.description: Delivery and item information for a shipment in a fulfillment order preview.

shippingNotes.description: Provides additional insight into the shipment timeline when exact delivery dates are not able to be precomputed.

FulfillmentPreviewShipmentList.description: An array of fulfillment preview shipment information.

FulfillmentReturnItemStatus.description: Indicates if the return item has been processed by a fulfillment center.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The return item has not yet been processed by a fulfillment center.
The return item has been processed by a fulfillment center.

FulfillmentShipment.description: Delivery and item information for a shipment in a fulfillment order.

amazonShipmentId.description: A shipment identifier assigned by Amazon.

fulfillmentCenterId.description: An identifier for the fulfillment center that the shipment will be sent from.

fulfillmentShipmentStatus.description: The current status of the shipment.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The process of picking units from inventory has begun.
All packages in the shipment have left the fulfillment center.

The Amazon fulfillment center could not fulfill the shipment as planned. This might be because the inventory was not at the expected location in the fulfillment center. After cancelling the fulfillment order, Amazon immediately creates a new fulfillment shipment and again attempts to fulfill the order.
The shipment was cancelled using the CancelFulfillmentOrder request.

shippingNotes.description: Provides additional insight into shipment timeline. Primairly used to communicate that actual delivery dates aren't available.

FulfillmentShipmentItem.description: Item information for a shipment in a fulfillment order.

packageNumber.description: An identifier for the package that contains the item quantity.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: The fulfillment order item identifier that the seller created and submitted with a call to the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

sellerSku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the shipped item.

FulfillmentShipmentItemList.description: An array of fulfillment shipment item information.

FulfillmentShipmentList.description: An array of fulfillment shipment information.

FulfillmentShipmentPackage.description: Package information for a shipment in a fulfillment order.

carrierCode.description: Identifies the carrier who will deliver the shipment to the recipient.

packageNumber.description: Identifies a package in a shipment.

trackingNumber.description: The tracking number, if provided, can be used to obtain tracking and delivery information.

FulfillmentShipmentPackageList.description: An array of fulfillment shipment package information.

GetFeatureInventoryResponse.description: The breakdown of eligibility inventory by feature.

GetFeatureInventoryResult.description: The payload for the getEligibileInventory operation.

featureSkus.description: An array of SKUs eligible for this feature and the quantity available.

nextToken.description: When present and not empty, pass this string token in the next request to return the next response page.

GetFeatureSkuResponse.description: The response schema for the getFeatureSKU operation.

GetFeatureSkuResult.description: The payload for the getFeatureSKU operation.

ineligibleReasons.description:
A list of one or more reasons that the seller SKU is ineligibile for the feature.

Possible values:
* MERCHANT_NOT_ENROLLED - The merchant isn't enrolled for the feature.
* SKU_NOT_ELIGIBLE - The SKU doesn't reside in a warehouse that supports the feature.
* INVALID_SKU - There is an issue with the SKU provided.

isEligible.description: When true, the seller SKU is eligible for the requested feature.

GetFeaturesResponse.description: The response schema for the getFeatures operation.

GetFeaturesResult.description: The payload for the getFeatures operation.

GetFulfillmentOrderResponse.description: The response schema for the getFulfillmentOrder operation.

GetFulfillmentPreviewItem.description: Item information for a fulfillment order preview.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: A fulfillment order item identifier that the seller creates to track items in the fulfillment preview.

sellerSku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

GetFulfillmentPreviewItemList.description: An array of fulfillment preview item information.

GetFulfillmentPreviewRequest.description: The request body schema for the getFulfillmentPreview operation.

featureConstraints.description: A list of features and their fulfillment policies to apply to the order.

includeCODFulfillmentPreview.description:
Specifies whether to return fulfillment order previews that are for COD (Cash On Delivery).

Possible values:

* true - Returns all fulfillment order previews (both for COD and not for COD).
* false - Returns only fulfillment order previews that are not for COD.

includeDeliveryWindows.description: Specifies whether to return the ScheduledDeliveryInfo response object, which contains the available delivery windows for a Scheduled Delivery. The ScheduledDeliveryInfo response object can only be returned for fulfillment order previews with ShippingSpeedCategories = ScheduledDelivery.

marketplaceId.description: The marketplace the fulfillment order is placed against.

GetFulfillmentPreviewResponse.description: The response schema for the getFulfillmentPreview operation.

GetFulfillmentPreviewResult.description: A list of fulfillment order previews, including estimated shipping weights, estimated shipping fees, and estimated ship dates and arrival dates.

GetPackageTrackingDetailsResponse.description: The response schema for the getPackageTrackingDetails operation.

InvalidItemReason.description: The reason that the item is invalid for return.

description.description: A human readable description of the invalid item reason code.

InvalidItemReasonCode.description: A code for why the item is invalid for return.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The item was not found in a fulfillment order.
A fulfillment return has already been requested for this item.
The fulfillment order containing this item has not yet shipped.
All item quantity available for return has been allocated to other return items.

InvalidReturnItem.description: An item that is invalid for return.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: The identifier assigned to the item by the seller when the fulfillment order was created.

sellerReturnItemId.description: An identifier assigned by the seller to the return item.

InvalidReturnItemList.description: An array of invalid return item information.

ListAllFulfillmentOrdersResponse.description: The response schema for the listAllFulfillmentOrders operation.

fulfillmentOrders.description: An array of fulfillment order information.

nextToken.description: When present and not empty, pass this string token in the next request to return the next response page.

ListReturnReasonCodesResponse.description: The response schema for the listReturnReasonCodes operation.

Money.description: An amount of money, including units in the form of currency.

currencyCode.description: Three digit currency code in ISO 4217 format.

NotificationEmailList.description: A list of email addresses that the seller provides that are used by Amazon to send ship-complete notifications to recipients on behalf of the seller.

carrierPhoneNumber.description: The phone number of the carrier.

carrierURL.description: The URL of the carrier’s website.

currentStatusDescription.description: Description corresponding to the CurrentStatus value.

customerTrackingLink.description: Link on swiship.com that allows customers to track the package.

signedForBy.description: The name of the person who signed for the package.

trackingNumber.description: The tracking number for the package.

ReasonCodeDetails.description: A return reason code, a description, and an optional description translation.

description.description: A human readable description of the return reason code.

returnReasonCode.description: A code that indicates a valid return reason.

translatedDescription.description: A translation of the description. The translation is in the language specified in the Language request parameter.

ReasonCodeDetailsList.description: An array of return reason code details.

ReturnAuthorization.description: Return authorization information for items accepted for return.

amazonRmaId.description: The return merchandise authorization (RMA) that Amazon needs to process the return.

fulfillmentCenterId.description: An identifier for the Amazon fulfillment center that the return items should be sent to.

returnAuthorizationId.description: An identifier for the return authorization. This identifier associates return items with the return authorization used to return them.

rmaPageURL.description: A URL for a web page that contains the return authorization barcode and the mailing label. This does not include pre-paid shipping.

ReturnAuthorizationList.description: An array of return authorization information.

ReturnItem.description: An item that Amazon accepted for return.

amazonReturnReasonCode.description: The return reason code that the Amazon fulfillment center assigned to the return item.

amazonShipmentId.description: The identifier for the shipment that is associated with the return item.

fulfillmentCenterId.description: The identifier for the Amazon fulfillment center that processed the return item.

returnAuthorizationId.description: Identifies the return authorization used to return this item. See ReturnAuthorization.

returnComment.description: An optional comment about the return item.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: The identifier assigned to the item by the seller when the fulfillment order was created.

sellerReturnItemId.description: An identifier assigned by the seller to the return item.

sellerReturnReasonCode.description: The return reason code assigned to the return item by the seller.

ReturnItemDisposition.description: The condition of the return item when received by an Amazon fulfillment center.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Item was damaged by the buyer or the seller.
Item was damaged by the carrier.

ReturnItemList.description: An array of items that Amazon accepted for return. Returns empty if no items were accepted for return.

ScheduledDeliveryInfo.description: Delivery information for a scheduled delivery.

deliveryTimeZone.description: The time zone of the destination address for the fulfillment order preview. Must be an IANA time zone name. Example: Asia/Tokyo.

ShippingSpeedCategory.description: The shipping method used for the fulfillment order.

TrackingAddress.description: Address information for tracking the package.

eventDescription.description: A description for the corresponding event code.

TrackingEventList.description: An array of tracking event information.

UnfulfillablePreviewItem.description: Information about unfulfillable items in a fulfillment order preview.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: A fulfillment order item identifier created with a call to the getFulfillmentPreview operation.

sellerSku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

UnfulfillablePreviewItemList.description: An array of unfulfillable preview item information.

UpdateFulfillmentOrderItem.description: Item information for updating a fulfillment order.

displayableComment.description: Item-specific text that displays in recipient-facing materials such as the outbound shipment packing slip.

fulfillmentNetworkSku.description: Amazon's fulfillment network SKU of the item.

giftMessage.description: A message to the gift recipient, if applicable.

orderItemDisposition.description: Indicates whether the item is sellable or unsellable.

sellerFulfillmentOrderItemId.description: Identifies the fulfillment order item to update. Created with a previous call to the createFulfillmentOrder operation.

sellerSku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

UpdateFulfillmentOrderItemList.description: An array of fulfillment order item information for updating a fulfillment order.

displayableOrderComment.description: Order-specific text that appears in recipient-facing materials such as the outbound shipment packing slip.

displayableOrderId.description: A fulfillment order identifier that the seller creates. This value displays as the order identifier in recipient-facing materials such as the outbound shipment packing slip. The value of DisplayableOrderId should match the order identifier that the seller provides to the recipient. The seller can use the SellerFulfillmentOrderId for this value or they can specify an alternate value if they want the recipient to reference an alternate order identifier.

featureConstraints.description: A list of features and their fulfillment policies to apply to the order.

marketplaceId.description: The marketplace the fulfillment order is placed against.

shipFromCountryCode.description: The two-character country code for the country from which the fulfillment order ships. Must be in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

UpdateFulfillmentOrderResponse.description: The response schema for the updateFulfillmentOrder operation.

info.description: The Selling Partner API for Fulfillment Outbound lets you create applications that help a seller fulfill Multi-Channel Fulfillment orders using their inventory in Amazon's fulfillment network. You can get information on both potential and existing fulfillment orders.
info.title: Selling Partner APIs for Fulfillment Outbound

get.description:
Returns a list of features available for Multi-Channel Fulfillment orders in the marketplace you specify, and whether the seller for which you made the call is enrolled for each feature.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 2 | 30 |

For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

parameters.description: The marketplace for which to return the list of features.
parameters.name: marketplaceId

features.featureDescription: Provides the ability to ship in non-Amazon branded packaging (blank boxes).
Provides the ability to insert customized packing slips with messages.

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

errors.message: The request must contain a valid marketplace.

401.description: The request's Authorization header is not formatted correctly or does not contain a valid token.

403.description: Indicates that access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The specified resource does not exist.

429.description: The frequency of requests was greater than allowed.

500.description: An unexpected condition occurred that prevented the server from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 2 | 30 |

For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

Returns the number of items with the sellerSKU you specify that can have orders fulfilled using the specified feature. Note that if the sellerSKU isn't eligible, the response will contain an empty skuInfo object.

**Usage Plan:**

| ---- | ---- |
| 2 | 30 |

For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

get.description:
Returns a list of fulfillment orders fulfilled after (or at) a specified date-time, or indicated by the next token parameter.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 2 | 30 |

For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

parameters.description: A date used to select fulfillment orders that were last updated after (or at) a specified time. An update is defined as any change in fulfillment order status, including the creation of a new fulfillment order.

Updates and/or requests shipment for a fulfillment order with an order hold on it.
